channel.title: Illinois News Bureau: Latest
channel.description: These are the latest news articles from the University of Illinois.

item.title: Faculty and staff members honored for excellence at Illinois
item.author: Steve WItmer, Director, News Bureau
item.description: Faculty and staff members, and graduate teaching assistants at the U. of I. were honored April 30 for excellence in teaching, mentoring and advising. Each was recognized during a reception at the Beckman Institute for Advanced Science and Technology.

item.title: Artist in-residence helping to create new theatrical work
item.author: Jodi Heckel, Arts and Humanities Editor
item.description: Lisa Gaye Dixon moves deliberately across the floor of the rehearsal stage, throwing her arms wide, hunching her shoulders and extending her hand from her forehead like a feather. Her expression is sometimes questioning, sometimes intense. Her costume includes a floor-length skirt supported by a crinoline underneath and a white ruff around her neck, echoing a picture of a black Elizabeth I on a board at the edge of the stage.

item.title: Six Illinois professors elected to National Academy of Sciences
item.author: Diana Yates, Life Sciences Editor
item.description: Six University of Illinois professors have been elected to the National Academy of Sciences, one of the highest professional honors a scientist can garner.

item.title: 400 youth to compete in statewide 4-H Robotics Challenge
item.author: Sharita Forrest, Education Editor
item.description: Nearly 400 youth from across Illinois will be on the University of Illinois campus Saturday (May 2) to compete in the seventh annual Illinois 4-H Robotics Challenge.

item.title: Three Illinois professors elected to the American Academy of Arts and Sciences
item.author: Diana Yates, Life Sciences Editor
item.description: Three University of Illinois professors have been elected to the American Academy of Arts and Sciences, one of the longest-standing honorary societies in the nation. Psychology professors J. Kathryn Bock and Gary S. Dell, and physics professor Taekjip Ha will join other new members in an induction ceremony in October in Cambridge, Massachusetts.

item.title: ELLNORA Guitar Festival to showcase diverse styles of guitar music
item.author: Jodi Heckel, Arts and Humanities Editor
item.description: The spectrum of music at ELLNORA: The Guitar Festival this fall will range from traditional Mexican guitar to southern rock, and from jazz to classical guitar. And the diversity is not just in the style of music, but the instruments as well. The guitar festival also features banjo, sarod, Hawaiian slack key guitar and pipa, a four-stringed Chinese lute.

item.title: U. of I. musicians perform on new CD by composer Augusta Read Thomas
item.author: Jodi Heckel, Arts and Humanities Editor
item.description: University of Illinois musicians – faculty members and students – perform works by renowned composer Augusta Read Thomas on a new CD. The music on “Astral Canticle” was recorded in December 2014 in the Great Hall at Krannert Center for the Performing Arts.

item.title: Eight honored with distinguished staff award
item.description: Eight civil service staff employees were honored with the Chancellor’s Distinguished Staff Award at a banquet April 13. The award recognizes exceptional performance.

item.title: Stephen Peterson of Ithaca College appointed to lead U. of I. bands program
item.author: Jodi Heckel, Arts and Humanities Editor
item.description: The longtime director of bands at Ithaca College will lead the University of Illinois concert and athletic bands, including the Marching Illini, beginning in August.

item.title: U. of I. humanities research program announces fellowship awards
item.author: Jodi Heckel, Arts and Humanities Editor
item.description: Seven faculty members and seven graduate students are recipients of Illinois Program for Research in the Humanities fellowships for the 2015-16 academic year. The fellowships support research and writing on topics chosen by the fellowship recipients.
